message: the little intertiminate progress widget goes back and forth, but never returns.
ok, did a bit more digging, and I'm getting a csrf error:
I'm trying to use gargoyle on a new project, and while I can create new switches from nexus on my local instance, doing so on the server always stalls.
Would @zeeg please come to the white courtesy topic...

Forbidden (403)

CSRF verification failed. Request aborted.
it's fixed in trunk. but due to the nature of the csrf protection in django, you have to visit a csrf enabled form first to get the cookie (e.g. the nexus login page)
(from Safari's resources inspector on gargoyle/add)
oh, interesting
/me goes to checkout trunk
Hm, updated to trunk and it doesn't seem to have fixed it. Logged out of nexus and back in again...
still getting 403?
yeah
i'm not seeing the cookie get passed around after the initial login
the {% csrf_token %} template tag should do that. it's supposed to be (at least) in the login template by default.
it is in the login form
and the cookie is set locally
for gargoyle/add
but i don't see it getting set in the request
My brain is slowly fading, but isn't there a context processor that needs to be enabled for that to work correctly?
If you remember where you read that, let me know
according to my experience, the middleware is enabled regardless of your settings (in 1.2.5)
Hrm so we've gt a bug in master of Nexus or Gargoyle?
(I fail at Convore)
actually, that wasn't it. crap.
i did eveentually get this working but I don't remember what i changed
i think it was actually a javascript issue
